Reviews.Title: “She is a grand old lady but a little tired.”
Reviews.Author: Tholepin
Reviews.Content: I like the Yesil Ev. She was a restored grand old lady of a house of a bygone era. She needs some restoring, again. The staff is wonderful and the setting delightful. One thing that draws us back is the garden and the conservatory; a great place to sit and have a beer after a long day of sightseeing/shopping or a quiet meal with it raining outside. We love the caravansary next door and it is a stone's throw to most of the key spots of the Sultanamet. There is paint cracked and peeling, and worn and broken bits here and there. Sort of what you might expect from Grandma's house but perhaps falling short of a first class boutique hotel that they aspire to be. Breakfast is more than adequate but not a sumptuous buffet. We hang on to her because, like an old relative or friend we can see through some of the superficial wear and tear but unfortunately we see a trend here and probably will give her a pass on our next visit to Istanbul and just go for the beer in the garden. For the nitty gritties, the bed was pretty firm (read mattress on a plywood foundation) the privacy shades were paint splattered and had to be repaired daily. There was a charge for bottled water in the room but it was waived on checkout. The street in front was being recobbled and blocked off when we were there but they hoped it would be finished by the end of April 2012.

Reviews.Title: “The Green House”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: Great central location near the blue mosque... Nice garden and original rooms,,, read a book called The Hellespont and visited Troy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel looking a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterEmmy
Reviews.Content: Yesil Ev was recommended to us by friends. The location in a small street in Sultanahmet is good - a few minutes walk from many of the major sites. At night it is quiet, but on some days there can be a fairly constant stream of passing tour buses. It is also very close to the blue mosque so be prepared to be woken by the call to prayer which sounds very loud when the windows are open. The walled courtyard garden is lovely and would be a great place to sit and enjoy a drink or food on a warm day. When it is raining hard - it's of limited value. The hotel decor is in need of refurbishment - peeling paintwork and furnishings. The air con was ineffective. The shower in our ensuite was tiny. The breakfast adequate but uninspiring. The staff are friendly and helpful. I am sure when this hotel first opened it was a great place to stay, but it now feels like it is trading on past reputation. We would happily return to sit in the garden, but not to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OldCath
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay - relaxed atmosphere, excellent service, wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Glamanda
Reviews.Content: My 2nd visit to Istanbul but this time for work so hotel was booked by the company and I was pleasantly surprised. The location was fantastic, right next to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The hotel iteself was boutique with a lovely leafy courtyard, serving a simple breakfast. The front desk was helpful and friendly. The room were small - the bed was comfortable, the bathroom small but clean. The shower was small and luckily it was no problem for me. My taller, bigger male colleagues did report some issues showering and keeping the water off the bathroom floor. There is no TV in the room and no elevator so it is not advised to bring heavy luggage. Overall I would recommend it as a charming boutique hotel in a very convenient location and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: GloriaAnchio
Reviews.Content: After a business trip we decided to spend two days as tourists. Rather than a business hotel, we chose a 21 room hotel located in a renovated, large 19th century wood house (except along stretches of the Bosphorous where the rich had summer homes few wood houses remain). We also went for location. Yesil Ev (green house) is located on a small street just to the side of Sultanahmet Square. It was perfect. Walk out and go to the left, and in 3 minutes you are at the Blue Mosque. Go to the right and in 4 minutes you are at Haghia Sophia. Go to the right and walk straight for about 5 minutes and you are at the entrance to the Topkapi Palace (more accurately, a huge area of various palace and civil administration buildings plus gardens). Our room in Yesil Ev was large, with lovely period furnishings. Shower power was terrific. Air conditioning was fine. Tip -- ask for a room off the street. It is a small street and noise (vehicles going by, conversations) floats up. One omission that might bother some -- no TV (or internet access). A room off the street would likely look over an unexpected feature of this hotel -- a lovely and sizable garden. Both nights we had dinner in th garden (which has glass conservatory part if it is cool). The staff were friendly and helpful. And if you want to dip into real luxury for dinner or brunch, the Sultanahmet Four Seasons is literally just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, great historic lodging.”
Reviews.Author: Koernbart
Reviews.Content: Location is top notch, how can you beat being between the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya and within walking distance from the Grand Bazaar and other main attractions? If in Istanbul for a short stay, this is an ideal spot from which to see it all. Old fashioned and dated dÃ©cor but the staff is accommodating and the backyard garden is great for enjoying complimentary breakfasts and/or a mid afternoon cocktail. Also near the unassuming yet beautifully restored Istanbul crafts center and gardens â€“ well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LucaEmma
Reviews.Content: If you require a spacious room with a large bathroom and walk-in shower, the Four Seasons is right around the corner, at about two times the price. Yesil Ev has the feel of a high-end bed and breakfast, in a beautifully restored historic home. Rooms are small and a bit dated, but very comfortable and clean. The garden is spectacular, and the location is unbeatable: right between the Blue Mosque and the Haggia Sophia. Be sure to ask for a room on the second or third floor, b/c highest floor rooms are cramped. Generous breakfast included in price, as well as a great discount for hand-crafted artwork from the adjacent workshops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; a very elegant place”
Reviews.Author: Angus61
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite place in Istanbul; I am a regular since 2004. I simply love it ! It's basically a bouquet pension, has not got the frills of a fancy big name hotel. No TV (who cares ?), gym, etc but free WiFi, a nice garden, nice elegant interiors and its own restaurant. The place is very well located. I go there mainly for business and after dinner, when I am at last free, I can enjoy a pleasant walk to the Hypodrome, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia (just around the corner) or to one of the many hammams to "steam off" literally. Suitable for a mature single traveller or a couple on a romantic trip. Unfit for families with kids. Not recommended for a long stay. Sleep quality is so-so due to the curtains which do not block light and at dawn you get the wake up call from the muezzin. Rooms are quite small but on the other hand if you spend there a couple of days, it's acceptable. Breakfast buffet is quite limited, and repetitive. Price is quite high though, they take advantage of the location (it's just across from the Four Seasons and I think they have benchmarked their prices accordingly) better to book directly and ask for a good price which you can get in certain low season periods.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overpriced & dated”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1023
Reviews.Content: Very expensive for a deluxe room on the top floor with inadequate air conditioning, a tiny bathroom, no TV and no view as the windows were over my head! No wireless in the the room, had to sit in the hall. The garden restaurant is lovely as is the building, but I saw several other hotels of an equal standard at that were much more reasonably priced. The rooms in boutique hotels in Istanbul are small in general but there are many boutique hotels in the area that are a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Location and charm”
Reviews.Author: JavierCC2
Reviews.Content: If you come to Istanbul looking for the luxuriest of the luxuriest, then go to the Four Seasons or to the Kempinsky. However if you like travelling to a atmosphere full of character, not so expensive and a little boutique flavour, then this is really the place. The friendly staff and the charming garden, the beautifull and absolutely clean rooms will do the rest. Dont expect too much from the breakfast and if you can avoid dinner (we went to have breakfast to the Kempinsky which is an experience I really recommend).

Reviews.Title: “Over priced regardless of location”
Reviews.Author: McBeck
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night -our last night of a 3 week touring vacation of Turkey. Agreed a great location, however, there are many great located hotels in the old city fort a fraction of the cost! Expected luxury accommodation and dinning. Disappointed on both levels. Accommodations faded and dining was ok,( even though my husband said the lamb chops were the best he ever had!) Breakfast is far from grand, fixed served menu. In short, not quiet the experience I expected for the cost. Staff friendly, awkward access to the hotel entrance, no lift, 3 flights of stairs (if on top floor), no TV, however internet access. Do not recommend on the bases of value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Turkish hospitality doesn't make up for miniscule rooms.”
Reviews.Author: docolo
Reviews.Content: We followed the advice of others on this website and booked four nights at the Yesil Ev. Upon arrival from the airport after 18 hours of travel, we were escorted up four flights of stairs to a tiny room on the top floor where we could not move around if we put our luggage on the floor. I went downstairs and requested a room change but the hotel was full. I was promised a change to the second floor the next day. The bed was comfortable and we were able to sleep, so it was acceptable. The room to which we moved the next day was slightly larger and in better condition than our "attic garret" and we did remain in the hotel. The people at the front desk were lovely and tried their best to answer all questions, give directions, etc. The breakfast was ample as most previous reviewers had stated. There is a very pretty garden where lunch is served weather permitting. The food was good and the service attentive. The location is prime--right in the heart of the principal sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but very simple accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Angeltwo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but generally no view on the monuments from the rooms. These are clean but very simple in accomodation. Usually no television, unless in the Pacha room. The bathrooms are very small. No lift. Prices are high for what you get. You pay for the location. The breakfast is good but very simple too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: marlenejmartin
Reviews.Content: First night in Istanbul we stayed in a terrible hotel. Called home the next morning to my daughter (6.30am UK time!) who contacted this hotel. Hotel was extremely helpful and we checked in one and half hours later and had a free breakfast. Staff very helpful and friendly. Accommodation was excellent. Breakfast very good. Very relaxed atmosphere. Location - very good for sight seeing. Would highly recommend this hotel. Beautiful garden to sit out in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Unsophisticated management of a lovely facility”
Reviews.Author: MikieSimon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pasha suite, which has its own hammam, very nice but no bathtub on the theory that you'll use the hammam. The decor is elaborate, with gold trim on everything. All the furniture is pushed to the walls, leaving an area in the middle suitable for gymnastics. While the food is ok at the restaurant in the greenhouse, the music at the outdoor terrace is far too loud, destroying the mood created by the fountain and walled setting. The management will turn it down to a dull roar but won't turn it off. This combined with the immediate proximity to the Blue Mosque's speakers make the final experience not worth the high price, even though the garden is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “The Yesil Ev is perfect for a visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AdamsTours
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the charming Yesil Ev, and I can't recomend it highly enough for anyone staying in Istanbul. The small hotel (30-something rooms) is a restored Ottoman villa. Its location is perfect--on a quite street in between Hagia Sophia and Sultanamet (the Blue Mosque). We could see Sultanamet from our room. Breakfast in the garden is delightful. The rooms are traditionally furnished and quite roomy. And the staff is the perfect combination of professional and helpful. They assisted me in arranging a taxi to visit several Byzantine churches and even retreived my cell phone which I had left at the Archeological Museum and mailed it back to me in the US. I'm hoping to return next summer. Peter Adams

Reviews.Title: “A lovely spot in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ladytravelmaven
Reviews.Content: I spent a delightful week here and had a very lovely time. Dinner in the the greenhouse was good and people could not have been kinder or more eager to please. The breakfast buffet was a bright spot each morning. As a special note I returned to Istanbul after touring Eastern Turkey for two weeks and took a friend to see the hotel for a quick visit before we flew out. The man at the front desk greeted me by name!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Joannaspencer
Reviews.Content: It would difficult to better the location of the Yesil Ev as it is so central to the main sights and enables you to get an early start ahead of the coach parties. With its charming garden it makes a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of the surrounding area. Our ground floor room overlooked the cobbled street and was quiet and of good proportions. It was fitted with repro furniture together with some older pieces to give a traditional feel. One soon became used to the call for prayer at first light which, when we were there, was at 4.50am. The staff, who spoke good English, were very helpful and eager to please . The pre-arranged airport transfers worked well and a local guide, organised by the hotel, was most informative and amenable. We were also grateful to have taxis ordered for us as it then ensured we had an honest driver something we realised very early on is a rarity. In the same area as the Four Seasons but at a third of the price this hotel is to be recommended not only for its sense of faded glory but above all its position.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel,small rooms”
Reviews.Author: chloeshiny
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite charming and it has the most beautiful garden i have ever seen.But our rooms was quite small,the king size bed in the room already took the whole place,and still there were 2 wardrobes in the rooms which is nonsense.Sleeping after the sunrise was impossible because the curtains were not really curtains(something like decorative curtains)so they were not enough to keep the sunshine away.The bathroom was small and not charming at all.Breakfast was just OK.Staff was helpful and nice though.We stayed for 2 nights though we had booked for 7.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jocon111
Reviews.Content: The Yesil Ev is a small hotel -- actually a converted merchant's house with a lovely garden. It has a great location -- about 200 yards from the Blue Mosque and also very close to the Topkapi Palace and other historic locations. The staff is very helpful and the rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: picturedesk2010
Reviews.Content: A frequent Istanbul traveler had recommended the Yesil Ev, and its location is ideal to see the highlights of the Old Town on foot. Now 21 years old, after its restoration by the Turkish Auto Touring Association, it needs a bit of sprucing up, particularly in comparison with the newer restorations by Touring on nearby cobblestone streets surrounding the Aya Sofia Mosque, Konuk Evi and Ayasofya Pensions. The staff, though, at Yesil Ev could not have been nicer or more helpful - Four Seasons service (the Four Seasons is in the next block) at less than half the price. They made excellent touring arrangements and airport transfers. The breakfast included was quite ample, but lunch and dinner are pricey, not so much for the food - a lunch was quite good - but for the overpriced wines. The garden court is a wonderful respite from a bustling city around.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: jsector
Reviews.Content: The Green House or Yesil Ev is an oasis in the busy Sultanhamet. We were so impressed with the staff and service we stayed a week and never blinked. The garden is a true haven for the weary and magical at night with the Hagia Sofia looming beyond the trees which form a canopy of shade during the day. The caring staff were so helpful it is our best feeling of personal contact with Turkey. Truly a wonderful experience. Everyone is smiling all day every day.

Reviews.Title: “How a room can affect ones perceptions...”
Reviews.Author: satorijane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice. The first time we had a super room overlooking the charming cobbled street. No tv but with a view like that I could not have cared less. It was spacious & lovely. However during that visit my husband had lamb chops for dinner and said one of them tasted funny after a couple of mouthfuls. Later that night he was violently ill. However it was probably a one off incident - we ate there again throughout the week that we were there with no further problems. I'd have given my first stay an above average rating. Our second stay was much less enjoyable. We had a small compact room with no television. It was right up on the top floor - a good climb up the stairs. I had to stand on a chair to see any views through the tiny windows at all. It was not a nice light filled room - rather ordinary in every way. I did feel ripped off somewhat... like an afterthought up there in the attic area! I defiinately won't be going back unless I can secure the room on the first floor that overlooks the street. I feel visitors should be aware rooms do differ and tbh value for money my second visit was most definately not! I'd have given this stay an extremely mediocre okay rating. I loved being in Istanbul but coming back to this after a long day was very disappointing. On the positive side the courtyard garden is lovely. The location is superb and staff are friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Taste of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fregro
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at both the Four Seasons and Yesil Ev. While my room at Yesil Ev was a bit small and did not have a TV, it did have beautiful period furnishings, a queen size bed, was very clean and did have an enclosed shower with very strong water pressure. While the hotel has only 19 rooms I wondered if it would be more like a B & B. It was however a real hotel with a very helpful English speaking staff, a good restaurant and a wonderful location. It is on a very quite street but close to all the sites. In the morning you can hear the call to prayer from the Blue Mosque. Everything was in walking distance, unlike the hotels on the European side where you must taxi to go anyplace of interest. Istanbul is an amazing destination !

Reviews.Title: “Location and Atmosphere Can't be Beaten!”
Reviews.Author: alliebdive
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and visited again this year but it was being renovated so didn't stay this time. The Yesil Ev (Green House) is a wonderful historic hotel right beside the Blue Mosque and the Santa Sophia in the heart of the historic Sultanmet district of Istanbul. Furnished with antiques and very atmospheric, the rooms are all different. We had a normal double room and also the Sultan's Suite. There is a good restaurant and a lovely garden in which you can also eat and have drinks and evening entertainment. There is no pool but the garden is cooling with a large fountain. The children stayed with us in the Sultan's Suite which was pretty over the top but worth the splurge. It had both a normal bathroom and a private hamam which the kids loved. It absolutely made up for there being no pool and was a lifesaver after a day out sightseeing in the heat. Basically, this is a marble tiled wet room where you could just empty a brass bucket of water over yourselves time and again - very fun and cooling. Your are literally a step away from the main sights and from many restaurants. The only issue is that being so close to the mosques (Blue Mosque is about 20 feet away) you do hear the prayer calls quite distinctly late at night and early in the morning. THis all adds to the flavour, but might not be your cup of tea if you are desperate for a good nights sleep. A home from home sort of atmosphere - very comfortable and friendly. Would definitely recommend and return. Beware carpet touts in the main square and tourist areas. They will strike up a seemingly friendly conversation and then try and guide you to their shop. Just walk away - they are persistent though.
